medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening somnolence after proximal femoral replacement surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Somnolence began 1 day after surgery. Prior to surgery, the patient experienced left hip pain starting 5 weeks ago after a fall in Haiti, which progressively worsened over time, leading to increased pain and difficulty bearing weight. Pain was initially managed with rest and ibuprofen, but it did not decrease. Pain continued during ambulation and while sleeping on the left side.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was previously healthy, taking no medications, and had no known allergies.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypertension and diabetes mellitus; no known family history of bone or soft-tissue cancer or of venous thromboembolism.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in an urban area of New England, drives a bus, does not smoke tobacco, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs. He was born in Haiti and has frequently returned there since moving to New England during childhood.
